# Data Visualization

  • Atlas — Easy way to make charts from your data that you can then download as an image or embed directly in your site.

  • Charted — Automatic charts from CSV or Google Spreadsheet data.

  • Cytoscape — Visualizing networks in nodes and edges.

  • easel.ly — Create and share visual ideas online.

  • Gliffy — Collaborative diagrams — flow charts, log frames, etc.

  • Google Charts — Google developer charts.

  • Piktochart — Infographics, reports, and presentations.

  • Plot.ly — Data analysis and graphing.

  • RAWGraphs — Data visualization framework sits between spreadsheets and graphics editors.

  • Dataviz Tools — Curated guide to tools, resources and technologies for data visualization.

  • PolicyViz — Helping people with everyday data visualizations.

  • The Data Visualisation Catalogue — Library of different information visualization types.

  • Remark — A simple, in-browser, markdown-driven slideshow tool.

  • D3 — JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data. Helps make awesome maps — but has a high learning curve.

  • Datamaps — Customizable SVG map visualizations for the web in a single JavaScript file using D3.js.

  • Google Fusion Tables — An experimental data visualization application to gather, visualize, and share data tables. Allows for maps, charts, Motion Chart a.k.a. GapMinder, etc.

  • R — Software programming language and software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

  • Tableau — Data visualization and business intelligence software (with built-in mapping charts and widgets).

  • Geojournalism — Online resources and training for journalists, designers and developers to dive into the world of data visualization using geographic data.
